Others: Denmark advanced to the last 16 at the European Championship after a 0-0 draw with Serbia on Tuesday.
The match ended with Denmark finishing Group C with three points, the same as Slovenia, but ended up in second place because of a better disciplinary record.
Serbia needed a victory to reach the next round but were unable to do so.
Denmark had most of the chances even though Serbia needed a victory to reach the next round, and almost all of those Danish opportunities came through Christian Eriksen.
Denmark coach Kasper Hjulmand expressed excitement about playing against host nation Germany in the next round.
Slovenia also advanced to the knockout stage at Euro 2024, eliminating Croatia, which finished third in Group B.
